meanings.definition: A horizontal piece of wood or stone at the bottom of a window or door frame.
meanings.sent1: The cat sat on the sill and watched the birds outside.
meanings.sent2: She placed the flowerpot on the window sill to catch the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the sill, eyeing the tasty treats inside.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams perched on the sill, waiting for the right moment to take flight.
meanings.sent5: The sill creaked under the weight of the curious child, exploring the world outside.

meanings.definition: A ledge or shelf at the bottom of a window.
meanings.sent1: The sill was adorned with colorful flowers, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent2: He leaned against the window sill, lost in thought.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked the vase off the sill, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes rested on the window sill, waiting for a sign of good luck.
meanings.sent5: The sill provided a perfect spot for the cat to bask in the warm sunlight.

meanings.definition: A threshold or ledge at the entrance to a building.
meanings.sent1: The old man sat on the sill of the shop, greeting passersby with a smile.
meanings.sent2: Children often play near the sill of the school entrance, waiting for their parents.
meanings.sent3: The sill of the library entrance witnessed many stories unfolding.
meanings.sent4: Her determination stood firm on the sill, ready to step into a new chapter.
meanings.sent5: The sill of the church entrance welcomed all who sought solace within its walls.
